property.name: text
property.value:
There should be two INPUT ports in this actor: 1, a wireless input port that receives data from 802.15.4 2, a payload input from upper application layer
two OUTPUT ports in this actor: 1, a wireless output port that sends data to 802.15.4 2, a port that delivers data to upper application layer

property.name: text
property.value: This actor model the reception of a packet from the radio point of view. Once a packet is received, the actor wait a certain time before to deliver it to the mac layer. Moreover, here we can check if the packet is valid or what type it is

svg.text: Create a state machine here (and ports, if needed) and create refinements for the states. Create transitions by holding the (Mac: command key, Windows: control key) and dragging from one state to another. Right click to configure the properties of this model, including setting the final state(s). Then delete this annotation.

property.name: text
property.value:
This dummy application layer only prints things out without doing anything useful.
Proof-of-concept of application.

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == true && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_ADV && ! dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == true && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_TXRX && dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == true && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_TX && dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == true && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_TXRX && ! dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: guardExpression
property.value: isSync == true && isrIeee154eNewSlot_isPresent && cellType == CELLTYPE_ADV && dataToSend_isPresent

property.name: annotation
property.value: here you set the frequency, load the packet, and turn on the radio (and you should also set the timer DURATION_tt2)

property.name: annotation
property.value: here you set the timer DURATION_tt3 and tell the radio to start transmitting

property.name: annotation
property.value: when receive a frame, you HAVE TO cancel timer tt3 and set timer DURATION_tt4

property.name: annotation
property.value: when the timer tt3 goes off, if nothing else happened

property.name: annotation
property.value: when timer tt4 goes off and you have't finished to send the packet-> ERROR

property.name: annotation
property.value: if it is not synchronized anymore

property.name: annotation
property.value: successfully sent a packet; cancel any timer

property.name: annotation
property.value: Turn on radio in rx mode schedule DURATION_tt6

property.name: annotation
property.value: DURATION_tt6 goes off, start listen to the radio; schedule DURATION_tt7

property.name: annotation
property.value: if timer DURATION_tt7 goes off, there is an error... check COMPONENT_RES_TO_IEEE802154E;

property.name: annotation
property.value: if DURATION_tt8 goes off cancel timers, no ack, abort

property.name: annotation
property.value: if receive ack before DURATION_tt8 goes off; turn off the radio, capture time.

property.name: annotation
property.value: take ownership of the packet (? COMPONENT_IEEE802154E)

property.name: annotation
property.value: take ownership of the packet (? COMPONENT_IEEE802154E)

property.name: annotation
property.value: here you have set tt5. turn off radio (radio_rfOff)

property.name: annotation
property.value: don't need to wait for ACK

property.name: annotation
property.value: enable radio in rx mode, set DURATION_rt2

property.name: annotation
property.value: if DURATION_rt2 goes off...start receiveing (radio_rxNow()); schedule DURATION_rt3

property.name: annotation
property.value: cancel timer rt3 and capture time (also syncCapturedTime); set DURATION_rt4

property.name: annotation
property.value: cancel timer rt3 and capture time (also syncCapturedTime), set DURATION_rt4

property.name: annotation
property.value: if DURATION_rt4 goes off, log error

property.name: annotation
property.value: cancel timer, turn off radio; take ownership of the packet... here SET DURATION_rt5

property.name: annotation
property.value: cancel timer, turn off radio; take ownership of the packet... you are done. do (// synchronize to the received packet iif I'm not a DAGroot and this is my preferred parent)

property.name: annotation
property.value: if not able to get a free buffer?

property.name: annotation
property.value: if you are able to take a buffer: calculate time correction and add it to the ack, find the frequency, upload packet, enable the radio and set DURATION_rt6

property.name: annotation
property.value: when timer rt6 goes off. set DURATION_rt7, enable radio to transmit (radio_txNow())

property.name: annotation
property.value: if timer rt7 goes off, log error

property.name: annotation
property.value: cancel timer, capture time; schedule DURATION_rt8

property.name: annotation
property.value: cancel timer, capture time, synchronize with the packet and notify packet received

property.name: text
property.value:
This state machine defines how the schedule looks like. For more information, see https://openwsn.atlassian.net/wiki/display/OW/Schedules
For now, the schedule according to OpenWSN implementation is hard-coded #define NUMADVSLOTS 1 #define NUMSHAREDTXRX 5 #define NUMSERIALRX 3
